This is why history is the record of so meny Democracies which have deceived all hopes based on them, and failed ignominiously. It is why they have so frequently reverted into absolute Monarchies and Oligarchies. It is why they have so often passed through a state of agitation and disorder into one of lethargie subjection to despotic rule.

Democracy can only succeed through the energy, intelligence, and virtue of the general body of its members3 through their successful resistance to temptatione, their avoidance of dangers, their reso- lute overcoming of difficulties, their sels-restraint and discipline, their moral and religious sincerity and eernestness. From Plato downwards all who have intelligently speculated on Democracy have seen that the problem on the solution of which its des- tiny depeuds is essentially an educational problem. A Democracy can only endure and flourish if the individuals who oompose it are in a healthy intellectual, moral, end religious condition.
